article.headline: Penn State 67, Buffalo 64
article.story: AMHERST N.Y. (AP) -- Ben Luber scored 17 points to lead Penn State in breaking a 23-game road losing streak with a 67-64 win over Buffalo Saturday night. Penn State (2-1) led 66-64 when Buffalo sent DeForrest Riley-Smith to the free throw line with 2.3 seconds to play. Riley-Smith made his first free throw but missed the second. The Bulls (0-3) rebounded the ball and passed it to Jason Bird at midcourt, but he could not get a shot off before time expired. Penn State, who led 33-29 at halftime, appeared set to run away with the game when they started the second half with a 10-2 run sparked by the return of their leading scorer Jan Jagla. Jagla played just three minutes in the first half after picking up two early fouls. But Jagla was called for a foul while guarding Buffalo's Yassim Idbihi with 15:07 to play and picked up a technical foul when he lost his cool after the call. Jagla returned to the game but fouled out with 8:52 left. After Jagla's dismissal, Buffalo went on an 11-0 run, capped by a 3-pointer from Roderick Middleton with 6:01 to go that gave the Bulls a 56-55 lead. Riley-Smith had 12 points and 10 rebounds, while Jagla scored 10 points in nine minutes of play. Idbihi led the Bulls with 17 points, while Daniel Gilbert had 13. Buffalo has lost their two home games by a combined five points.
